content.prompt:
In addition to their role in urine scent marking, MHC proteins are used by body cells in both sexes of mice to distinguish self cells that originate in an individual’s body from nonself cells that do not originate in an individual’s body.

Which of the following best explains how MHC-related odor-producing molecules might be used to maintain genetic diversity in mouse populations?

choices.label: They could be used by female mice for mate selection to avoid mating with related individuals.
They could be used by subordinate males to attract dominant males to the area to enrich the gene pool.
They could be used by subordinate males to decrease competition with other males resulting in increased genetic diversity.
They could be used by females to decrease bacterial infections that occur during pregnancy.
